abstract.p: Manu Radhakrishnan letter on Miranda warnings says role of defense lawyer is not to shield those guilty of crimes from appropriate convictions but to ensure that due process is observed (July 6 Erica S Perl Op-Ed article)

block.p: Re ''It Feels So Good to Confess'' (Op-Ed, July 6):

Erica S. Perl seemed disappointed that her guilty clients confessed despite being told of their Miranda rights. Surely the role of a defense lawyer is not to shield those guilty of crimes from appropriate convictions but to ensure that due process is observed at each step.
Re ''It Feels So Good to Confess'' (Op-Ed, July 6):

Erica S. Perl seemed disappointed that her guilty clients confessed despite being told of their Miranda rights. Surely the role of a defense lawyer is not to shield those guilty of crimes from appropriate convictions but to ensure that due process is observed at each step.
If someone confesses to a crime without the confession's having been extracted by force, that is a good thing and allows the criminal justice system to convict criminals in an efficient way.
